Class DefaultInternalAction

  • java.lang.Object
    • jason.asSemantics.DefaultInternalAction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    InternalAction, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    abolish, add_annot, add_nested_source, add_plan, all_names, asserta, assertz, at, atom, broadcast, clear, clone, concat, copy_term, count, create_agent, current_intention, date, delete, df_register, difference, drop_all_events, drop_all_intentions, drop_intention, empty, eval, fail, findall, foreach, fork, ground, if_then_else, include, intend, join, kill_agent, length, list, list_plans, list_rules, literal, loop, lower_case, member, mi, min, my_name, namespace, nth, number, perceive, plan_label, prefix, print_unifier, println, puts, random, range, relevant_plans, relevant_rules, remove_plan, rename_apart, resume, reverse, save_agent, send, setof, shuffle, sort, stopMAS, string, structure, sublist, substring, succeed_goal, suffix, suspend, suspended, term2string, time, upper_case, verbose, wait
    public class DefaultInternalAction
extends java.lang.Object
implements InternalAction, java.io.Serializable
    Default implementation of the internal action interface (it simply returns false for the interface methods). Useful to create new internal actions.
    Author:
    Jomi
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • execute

        public java.lang.Object execute​(TransitionSystem ts,
                                Unifier un,
                                Term[] args)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: InternalAction
        Executes the internal action. It should return a Boolean or an Iterator. A true boolean return means that the IA was successfully executed. An Iterator result means that there is more than one answer for this IA (e.g. see member internal action).
        Specified by:
        execute in interface InternalAction
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
